questions.text:
A 49-year-old man comes to the emergency department with severe shortness of breath. The patient has a history of hypertension and medication nonadherence. Blood pressure is 260/144 mm Hg and pulse is 100/min. Chest examination demonstrates bibasilar crackles.

Intravenous furosemide and continuous nitroprusside infusion are started, along with noninvasive positive pressure ventilation, and he experiences improvement in his symptoms. The next morning, the patient is confused and lethargic, and he suffers a generalized tonic-clonic seizure. The skin appears flushed, and serum lactic acid level is elevated. The nitroprusside infusion rate is found to be higher than recommended. Which of the following mechanisms is most likely responsible for the drug toxicity seen in this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Inhibition of electron transfer to oxygen

Physical examination shows scattered ecchymoses. The abdomen is soft and nontender. Rectal examination shows maroon-colored, guaiac-positive stool. questions.text:
Identify the correct statements:

 

  1. In a patient with Wilson's disease, 3-methylhistidine is decreased in urine

  2. Direct positive Van der bergh's reaction is seen in a case of obstructive jaundice

  3. If the percentage of thymine residues in DNA is 28%, percentage of cytosine is 22%

  4. Thermogenin is present in the mitochondria
questions.solution:
Ans. A) 1, 2, 3, 4

 

Statement 1. Glucagon challenge test can be used to distinguish Von Gierke’s disease and Cori’s disease: True. In Von Gierke’s disease (Type I), there is a deficiency of glucose-6-phosphatase, preventing hepatic release of glucose after glucagon administration, so no rise in blood glucose occurs. In Cori’s disease (Type III), caused by debranching enzyme deficiency, the glucagon challenge still produces a modest rise in glucose since some glycogenolysis remains functional — making this test useful for differentiation.

 

Statement 2. Choline should be avoided by patients with trimethylaminuria: True. Trimethylaminuria (fish-odor syndrome) is due to a deficiency of flavin-containing monooxygenase-3 (FMO3), which normally converts trimethylamine (TMA) to its odorless form. Since choline is metabolized to TMA, restricting dietary choline (found in eggs, fish, and legumes) helps minimize odor symptoms.

 

Statement 3. Oculocutaneous albinism type 1 (tyrosinase deficiency) is AR: True. Oculocutaneous albinism type I is caused by a defect in the tyrosinase (TYR) gene, leading to absent melanin synthesis in skin, hair, and eyes. It follows an autosomal recessive inheritance pattern, requiring both alleles to be mutated for expression.

 

Statement 4. Creatine is synthesized from glycine, arginine, and methionine: True. Creatine synthesis occurs in two steps — first, arginine and glycine combine to form guanidinoacetate; then methionine (as S-adenosyl-methionine) donates a methyl group to form creatine. This compound stores energy as phosphocreatine in muscle and brain tissue.

questions.text: A researcher placed two functional mRNA sequences that contain trinucleotide repeats of CUC and CUU into a solution containing functional ribosomes and tRNAs that have the appropriate amino acids. After a few hours, it was observed that both mRNA sequences resulted in the production of polypeptide chains with repeated leucine amino acids. Which genetic principle can explain the observed outcome in this experiment?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) Degenerate

 

The experiment describes two different codons — CUC and CUU — each coding for the same amino acid (Leucine).


Despite the difference in the third base, both yield the same protein product (a polypeptide made of repeated leucine residues).

 

This illustrates the genetic code’s degeneracy (redundancy) — multiple codons can code for the same amino acid.

 

Genetic Code Features:

questions.solution: Ans. B) Due to sulph-meth-hemoglobin accumulation and formation

choices.text: It involves only a group of voluntary muscles

questions.text: Which of the following is true about Rigor Mortis?
questions.solution: Ans. C) It does not occur in a fetus <7 months old

questions.text: Which of the following is true about the structural organization of proteins?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Tertiary structure is three dimensional
